tidysq 0.5.0
  • Reference

Reverse sequence

Source: R/reverse.R
reverse.Rd

Reverse given list of sequences.

reverse(sq)

Arguments

sq

a sq object.

Value

A sq object of the same type as input object but each sequence is reversed.

Details

The reverse function reverses each sequence in supplied sq object (e.q. transforms "MIAANYTWIL" to "LIWTYNAAIM"). Empty sequences are left with no effect. This operation does not change the type of the input object nor its alphabet.

Since the function reverse returns a sq object, the print function is implicitly called.

See also

sq clean sq-print

Examples

# Creating sq objects using construct_sq:
sq_ami <- construct_sq(c("MIAANYTWIL","TIAALGNIIYRAIE", 
                         "NYERTGHLI", "MAYXXXIALN"), type = "ami")
sq_dna <- construct_sq(c("ATGCAGGA", "GACCGAACGAN", ""), type = "dna")
sq_unt <- construct_sq(c("ATGCAGGA!", "TGACGAGCTTA", "", "TIAALGNIIYRAIE"))

# Reverse sequences:
reverse(sq_ami)

# Reverse cleaned sequences:
reverse(clean(sq_ami))
